title: Calories in 5 oz Salmon
meta_description: Discover calories in 5 oz salmon, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown per 100 g basis, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
assumptions: Farmed Atlantic salmon fillet, baked or grilled, skinless; no added oil, salt, or seasonings; 5 oz â‰ˆ142 g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by salmon type (wild vs. farmed), cut, cooking method, and portion size. Check labels or sources for precision.

quick_answer.text: 5 oz cooked salmon offers ~292 kcal and ~31 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp olive oil per 100 g during cooking
Use wild salmon (leaner, fewer calories per 100 g)

faqs.q: How many calories in 5 oz cooked salmon?
faqs.a: Approximately 292 kcal for baked, skinless farmed salmon.

faqs.q: What's the protein in 5 oz salmon?

faqs.a: No carbs, fiber, or sugars in plain cooked salmon.
Wild is leaner (~182 kcal/100 g) vs. farmed (~206 kcal/100 g); adjust for type.

faqs.q: How does cooking affect salmon calories?
faqs.a: Baking/grilling keeps calories steady; frying with oil adds ~40 kcal per tsp per 100 g.
